pros: good workplace, great diversity with culture
cons: distance to drive, long waiting time for translation service

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Wichita, KS
pros: -actively hire new RNs, many different types of ICUs
cons: - Staff to patient ratio was high and getting a lunch break was rare

pros: Great machines, work flow and teamwork within radiology and CT departments. Great radiology nurses and better radiologists
cons: Management does not value their employees, the former CT managers did and currently do reward tattling on coworkers.

pros: Benefits are great and policies are black and white
cons: Lack of support to management

good work experience in primary and comprehensive stroke centers.
Comfortable managing acute stroke pts including tPA pts.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Wichita, KS
pros: They provide for their employees
cons: The pay should be consistent with local similar positions.

pros: Friendly Staff Good Benefits Good Work/Life Balance
cons: Dirty at times Construction ongoing

pros: The other people (nurses, doctors, RT, CNAs) that I work with- teamwork has never really been a problem. My coworkers make the job easier and less stressful, even when we are busy. They are currently playing with the idea of self-scheduling, which would be very nice.
cons:
Opportunity for growth is pretty stunted- it's hard to transfer in and out of different units if you don't know someone. Pay raises used to be unheard of until employee engagement surveys started plummeting and turn over was pretty high- now each year you can bet on a "nice" 1-2% raise, no bonuses and yearly increasing cost of benefits. Base pay is WELL BELOW the national average, and that is in the ENTIRE city of Wichita. 

Also, management turnover is pretty high. In the two and half years I've worked here, we have lost 3 unit managers, an ACNO and the CEO of my campus and the head CEO of the main campus.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Glens Falls, NY
pros: Always over time not matter what
cons: You work alone most the time not enough staff

review_title: Love the people I work with, but senior management is driving out all the experienced nurses by cutting benefits.
pros: Great atmosphere of teamwork.  Level 1 trauma hospital, so lots of opportunities for learning and keeping up with the latest in technology and evidence-based practice and protocols.
cons: They cut shift differential pay, which negatively affected the nurses who had any longevity with the company.  The CEO was promoted to the SE area of the U.S. and is now CEO of 15 HCA hospitals -- he got this promotion because of the money he saved the corporation through this pay cut.   Loyalty no longer counts.  The experienced nurses are exiting in droves or being picked on for infractions that had never been an issue before, leaving only new nurses as the majority.

review_title: Once it was a family, but then profit got in the way
pros: Covered employee parking, expensive but complete health benefits, great compensation increases if you have an RN after your name, a clean and nutritional employee cafeteria that serves edible food for being in the middle of a hospital
cons: If you're not licensed health care professional (RN, therapies, radiology tech, etc.), you don't work for Wesley, you work for a contract service that pays substandard rates, has substandard benefits, and has unrealistic expectations for productivity. Senior management has publicly admitted they would fire their own mother to save a dollar. Pay increases are yearly, across the board, and rarely make up for increases in health benefits.

review_title: Overall, I'm satisfied but I feel like the oppurtunities for advancement as slim.
pros: It's a great facility, where most of the employees are extemely friendly and supportive.  The facililty is always looking ahead technologically speaking.  Employee retention is extremely high in most departments.
cons: The workforce is older and while retention is high, this is not always a positive.  Oppurtinites for advancement normally only occur when someone either retires or moves up themselves.

review_title: They try, but they are for profit
job_title: Float Pool RN in Wichita, KS
pros: The majority of the nursing staff is pleasant and helpful. There are always a few bad apples in every bunch. Administration tries to make the staff feel important and know they make a difference.
cons: The yearly raises were laughable. When it comes down to it, management does everything for the doctors and the profits.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Wichita, KS
pros: I work in Labor and Delivery at the main hospital and I absolutely adore it.  There is amazing team work here and I don't think I could've asked for better coworkers.  PTO is very reasonable and the nurse managers always try to work with you if you have an important event.  Morale is also very high on this unit even when it gets crazy we somehow always pull together.
cons: Wesley does not pay their nurses what they are worth, which is a common complaint in Kansas.  I also believe the orientation program and some of the policies are a bit outdated and need a great deal of work.

review_title: Relief Charge Nurse and floor RN in a progressive Cardiac Medical/Surgical Telemetry Unit for five years
pros: Being part of this management team, with an extreme number of years in Nursing has demonstrated the balance between stern, fair and available. Outstanding communications. during this time I have mentored numerous students and novice staff members in proper IV placement and maintenance.
cons: We have recently loss a good deal of nurses. This has been the direct result of personnel advancement to APRN's. As a result, many of our RN's have less years on the job. On the up side, these RN's possess the newest, freshest training and are eager to perform well.

pros: Great experiences and coworkers.  Many areas available to work at with many different shifts.
cons: Heavy patient load and high turnover rate.  Hospital has history for poor staffing resulting in patient deaths in 1999 and 2004.  There may be others but Wesley wanted records sealed as part of settlement and the family refused.  Low pay for the top revenue grossing HCA hospital.  Administration does not listen to staff.

pros: The benefits were good, I liked The ED Director and Manager. The Nurse leads were nice. They give opportunities to new grads.  I concluded the ED was not for me, yet.
cons: The only ED I have worked in but the stress was higher than i expected. Moving patients out of their rooms and into the halls due to over capacity was unexpected. I concluded the ED was not for me, yet.

review_title: Wesley Hospital a good place to start but dated HCA's dated technology approach and pay leave a lot to be desired.
pros: Great people. Very busy hospital. Great tertiary care experience. Level one trauma center. Amazing PICU and NICU. Great Trauma department.
cons: Salary is par for the city but not the region. Meditech charting system is dated and unusable.

review_title: This was a great place to work and the staff is always amazing.
pros: They have a great place to eat. Also, they really do take care of the employees and the staff.  I would recommend to anyone.
cons: There really is not much bad to say about this company.  They are always willing to help the employees with their needs.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Wichita, KS
pros: Competitive pay and wonderful people to work with. Great benefits and such a great facility. Room for advancement and education opportunities.
cons: Sometimes hours are cut when census is low, which sucks, but there is usually opportunities to float to other units if you're up for it.
